intro: Pyrus tobisimensis, commonly known as the Tobišimense pear, is a rare species native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and edible fruits. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, preferring cool and humid climates. Its leaves are broad and lobed, with a slightly hairy surface. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its natural environment.
